author: Special Correspondent
text:
The idols of Goddess Meenakshi and Lord Sundareswarar being taken to Vaigai river for a special ‘theerthavari,’ in Madurai on Monday.— Photo: R. Ashok

The presiding deities of the Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple, Goddess Meenakshi and Lord Sundareswarar, were taken to the Vaigai riverbed for a special ‘theerthavari’ on the rare occasion of Mahodaya Amavasai on Monday.

Mahodaya Amavasai is a rare event, with a combination of Amavasai (new moon day), Tiruvonam (star) in Thai (Tamil month), Monday (day) and Vyatipatam (yogam), that occurs once in 140 years, according to the Executive Officer of Sri Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple, N. Natarajan.

The presiding deities, along with Lord Vinayaka, Lord Murugan and Lord Chandikeswarar, were taken in a procession from the temple to the Vaigai riverbed, temple priest Senthil Bhattar said. Special puja and abishekam were performed on the occasion of ‘theerthathavari.’
title: Special ‘theerthavari’ on Mahodaya Amavasai
